intro: Tristiropsis canarioides, commonly known as the Canary Island heath, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related species. The plant is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and small, leathery leaves. It produces clusters of bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Tristiropsis canarioides is adapted to grow in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas.
